etymology.description: 搅(攪) + 拌 = agitate/stir + mix → stir and mix together.
etymology.interpretation: Combines two near-synonymous hand-actions, emphasizing continuous motion to make contents uniform. Often used for food, liquids, or powders.
etymology.simplification: 攪 was simplified to 搅 by replacing the phonetic 覺 with its simplified 觉 under the hand radical 扌, reducing strokes; 拌 remained unchanged.

parts.english: to stir up; to agitate; to disturb; to mix
to mix; to toss (food); to blend; to stir

examples.chinese: 用勺子把汤搅拌均匀(用勺子把湯攪拌均勻)。
examples.pinyin: Yòng sháozi bǎ tāng jiǎobàn jūnyún.
examples.english: Use a spoon to stir the soup evenly.

examples.chinese: 把面粉和鸡蛋搅拌成糊(把麵粉和雞蛋攪拌成糊)。
examples.pinyin: Bǎ miànfěn hé jīdàn jiǎobàn chéng hú.
examples.english: Mix the flour and eggs into a batter.

examples.chinese: 先把沙拉酱和蔬菜搅拌一下(先把沙拉醬和蔬菜攪拌一下)。
examples.pinyin: Xiān bǎ shālājiàng hé shūcài jiǎobàn yíxià.
examples.english: First toss the salad dressing with the vegetables.
